physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 29-year-old woman experienced itching and oozing at the occipital donor site after split-skin graft. Examination revealed tufted hair folliculitis at the donor site.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms started half a year post-surgery and responded well to local treatment with fusidic acid and mometasone propionate, leading to a cessation of inflammation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 3-year-old girl who underwent MRI showed three full-thickness burns at the points where electrodes were attached to the chest.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Wounds were treated conservatively with significant scarring.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 41-year-old woman post-skin-sparing mastectomy reported pain at the left costal margin which was exacerbated after discharge.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially managed with dressings, her condition worsened, leading to surgery where samples grew Pseudomonas but showed no pus.
